entry.title: Episode 56: Politics, Paranoia, and the "Vital Center"

media:group.media:title: Episode 56: Politics, Paranoia, and the "Vital Center"
media:group.media:description: The "paranoid style" is back in American politics, and the notion of an American "vital center" has collapsed.

entry.title: Episode 55: Historians at the White House

media:group.media:title: Episode 55: Historians at the White House
media:group.media:description:
As you may have read / heard, a select group of historians paid a visit to the White House last week...
The original story: "Historians Privately Warn Biden That America's Democracy is Teetering", The Washington Post, Aug 10 https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2022/08/10/biden-us-historians-democracy-threat/
"We Are Living Through a Battle for the Soul of This Nation", The Atlantic, Aug 27, 2017 https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2017/08/joe-biden-after-charlottesville/538128/

entry.title: Episode 54: The Future of the Historian

media:group.media:title: Episode 54: The Future of the Historian
media:group.media:description:
Amid today's building Crisis tensions, the future of the historian is coming into clearer focus.
Please, PLEASE share this episode with others...this is the single most important one of the entire series.
Herbert Butterfield, The Whig Interpretation of History, Electronic Library of Historiography, HTML edition re-published 2002 http://www.eliohs.unifi.it/testi/900/butterfield/index.html

entry.title: Episode 53: The Problem with "Hard Times Create Strong Men"

media:group.media:title: Episode 53: The Problem with "Hard Times Create Strong Men"
media:group.media:description: A meme is going around which has been incorrectly attributed to The Fourth Turning. But more importantly, the meme is doing more than distorting one book's insights...it is misrepresenting the picture of where current events stand in America, and where events might be headed.

entry.title: Episode 52: A Conflict of Visions - Readings from Nietzsche, Sorokin, Sowell, & Hamilton

media:group.media:title: Episode 52: A Conflict of Visions - Readings from Nietzsche, Sorokin, Sowell, & Hamilton
media:group.media:description: Four readings from four different thinkers in three different centuries which give context to the latest American crisis

entry.title: Episode 51: The President, The "New World Order", & The Fourth Turning

media:group.media:title: Episode 51: The President, The "New World Order", & The Fourth Turning
media:group.media:description:
Lots of conversation about a "new world order" followed President Biden's comments last week. Was he referencing The Fourth Turning?
Minneapolis Star Tribune column by D.J. Tice, "For book that predicted season of 'crisis,' the time has come", March 19th https://www.startribune.com/article/600157639/?refresh=true
Remarks by President Biden at Business Roundtable Meeting, March 21st https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/speeches-remarks/2022/03/21/remarks-by-president-biden-before-business-roundtables-ceo-quarterly-meeting/
Remarks by President Biden at Royal Castle in Warsaw, March 26th https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/speeches-remarks/2022/03/26/remarks-by-president-biden-on-the-united-efforts-of-the-free-world-to-support-the-people-of-ukraine/

media:group.media:title: Episode 50: Today's "Dominant Minorities"
media:group.media:description:
20th century historian Arnold Toynbee's wrote about a phenomenon called "dominant minorities" decades ago. Why are the West's dominant minorities behaving as they are today?
"Crisis of Legitimacy", First Things (a publication of The Institute on Religion and Public Life), by R. R. Reno, December 2021 https://www.firstthings.com/article/2021/12/crisis-of-legitimacy

media:group.media:title: Episode 49: Is 2022 the "Gate" Year?
media:group.media:description:
Strauss and Howe wrote that this "fourth turning" era would feature a "great gate" moment at which history would reach a crucial and irrevocable pivot point. Will that moment come in 2022?
Dr. Jordan Peterson for The National Post, Jan 19 https://nationalpost.com/opinion/jordan-peterson-why-i-am-no-longer-a-tenured-professor-at-the-university-of-toronto
Victor Davis Hanson for American Greatness, Jan 19 https://amgreatness.com/2022/01/19/is-america-heading-for-a-systems-collapse/

entry.title: Episode 48: "Save Democracy" Mania Part 1 - The Fourth Turning

media:group.media:title: Episode 48: "Save Democracy" Mania Part 1 - The Fourth Turning
media:group.media:description:
You'd have to be living in a bank vault not to catch all the chatter lately about the need to "save democracy". Where did this bumper sticker come from? Here is Part 1...after Donald Trump became president, Steve Bannon's fascination with The Fourth Turning put the book under a microscope. It was never called a "threat to democracy" directly...but that doesn't mean conversations about it then, didn't augur the conversations going on now.
"Political Upheaval by Design", NPR On Point, Boston WBUR affiliate, Apr 11 2017 https://www.wbur.org/onpoint/2017/04/11/fourth-turning-steve-bannon
"Bannon's Views Can be Traced to a Book that Warns, 'Winter is Coming'", Jeremy Peters, The New York Times, Apr 8 2017 https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/08/us/politics/stephen-bannon-book-fourth-turning.html
"The Outsider as Insider: Steve Bannon, Fourth Turnings, and the Neo-Fascist Threat", www.academia.edu https://www.academia.edu/38989953/_The_Outsider_as_Insider_Steve_Bannon_Fourth_Turnings_and_the_Neo_Fascist_Threat_Chapter_
"The Coming Depression: Imagination in Politics Old and New", joelowndes.org, Apr 10 2020 https://www.joelowndes.org/post/the-coming-depression-politics-old-and-new

entry.title: Episode 47: Different Roads - It's a Wonderful Life and The Fourth Turning

media:group.media:title: Episode 47: Different Roads - It's a Wonderful Life and The Fourth Turning
media:group.media:description: It's a Wonderful Life premiered in theaters 75 years ago this Christmas week. The contrast between the era portrayed in the film and our own, speaks for itself.

entry.title: Episode 46: They Were Bigger People Somehow

media:group.media:title: Episode 46: They Were Bigger People Somehow
media:group.media:description:
80 years after Pearl Harbor, nostalgia for the World War II generation as is great as ever...and for good reason.
Google Books link to Life Magazine issue with page featuring "What the U.S.A. Thinks" Survey, Jul 29 1940 https://books.google.com/books?id=xz8EAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA20&source=gbs_toc_r&cad=2#v=onepage&q&f=false
"The American Century" by Henry Luce http://www-personal.umich.edu/~mlassite/discussions261/luce.pdf
Time Magazine, "America Learned the Wrong Lessons From Pearl Harborâ€”And the World Is Still Living With the Consequences", Dec 6 2021 https://time.com/6125923/america-wrong-lessons-pearl-harbor/
Thomas Sowell QnA with Peter Robinson of the Hoover Institution at Stanford discussing "Dismantling America" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5SDLBqIubCs

entry.title: Episode 45: The Revolt of the Masses & The Revolt of the Elites

media:group.media:title: Episode 45: The Revolt of the Masses & The Revolt of the Elites
media:group.media:description:
The Revolt of the Masses was remarkably prescient in foreseeing what lay ahead in the 1930s. The Revolt of the Elites may have been as prescient for today.
Foreign Policy, "It's Time for the Elites to Rise Up Against the Ignorant Masses", James Traub, Jun 28 2016 https://foreignpolicy.com/2016/06/28/its-time-for-the-elites-to-rise-up-against-ignorant-masses-trump-2016-brexit/

entry.title: Episode 44: This is not a "Culture War"

media:group.media:title: Episode 44: This is not a "Culture War"
media:group.media:description: In light of the heated contest for governor in Virginia, much has been written and said in recent weeks about how America is in a "culture war". That's not the conclusion where the trail of evidence leads.

entry.title: Episode 43: The Wrong Side of the Language of History

media:group.media:title: Episode 43: The Wrong Side of the Language of History
media:group.media:description:
When moral absolutes not only infuse the language of history, but dominate it, there are consequences.
Jon Meacham in Time Magazine, "American Hate, A History", August 17, 2017 https://time.com/4904290/american-hate-a-history/
Joe Biden in The Atlantic, "We Are Living Through a Battle for the Soul of This Nation", August 27, 2017 https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2017/08/joe-biden-after-charlottesville/538128/
President Biden's nomination speech, August 21, 2020 https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/20/politics/biden-dnc-speech-transcript/index.html
President Biden's victory speech, November 7, 2020 https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-religion-technology-race-and-ethnicity-2b961c70bc72c2516046bffd378e95de
President Biden's inaugural address, January 20, 2021 https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/speeches-remarks/2021/01/20/inaugural-address-by-president-joseph-r-biden-jr/
Ken Burns on the SmartLess Podcast, September 2021 https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/ken-burns/id1521578868?i=1000535978926
Jon Meacham's HBO documentary, "The Soul of America" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RHv1GbkRhSI

media:group.media:title: Episode 42: 9/11 in Retrospective History
media:group.media:description: The power of stories in shaping history is incalculable. 20 years after 9/11, what did the retrospectives say about our conceptions of the event and of history?
